original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at 303.85/95 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee closed at 303.85/95 to the US dollar in the spot forex market on Thursday, stronger from 304.00/20 on Wednesday, dealers said, while bond yields were up.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 closed at 11.35/40 percent up from 11.30/40 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 11.85/95 percent down from 11.90/12.00 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 closed at 12.10/15 percent down from 12.15/20 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.07.2029 closed at 12.15/30 percent up from 12.10/30 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 closed at 12.15/30 percent up from 12.10/30 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.03.2031 closed stable at 12.10/35 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2032 closed at 12.30/50 percent up from 12.25/50 percent. (Colombo/Mar21/2024)
